goals.question: What is the distribution of volcano elevation?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of elevation values and their frequency in the dataset.

goals.question: What is the relationship between volcano elevation and type?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a significant difference in elevation between different types of volcanoes.

goals.question: What is the distribution of volcano type?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of different types of volcanoes in the dataset.

goals.question: What is the relationship between volcano type and region?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of different types of volcanoes across different regions.

goals.question: What is the relationship between volcano elevation and region?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a significant difference in elevation between different regions where volcanoes are located.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.hist(data['Elevation'], bins=20, color='green', alpha=0.5)
    plt.axvline(data['Elevation'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f'Median: {data["Elevation"].median():.2f}')
    plt.legend(loc='upper right')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of volcano elevation?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Type'] = data['Type'].astype('category')
    chart = data.boxplot(column='Elevation', by='Type', figsize=(10,6))
    chart.set_xlabel('Type')
    chart.set_ylabel('Elevation')
    chart.set_title('What is the relationship between volcano elevation and type?')
    chart.axhline(data['Elevation'].median(), color='r', linestyle='--', label='Median Elevation: {:.2f}'.format(data['Elevation'].median()))
    chart.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Type'].value_counts().plot(kind='bar')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of volcano type?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.groupby(['Region', 'Type']).size().unstack()
    data.plot(kind='bar', stacked=True)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between volcano type and region?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend(title='Type')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Region'] = data['Region'].astype('category')
    data['Elevation'] = pd.to_numeric(data['Elevation'], errors='coerce')
    data = data.dropna(subset=['Elevation'])
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.scatter(data['Region'], data['Elevation'], alpha=0.5)
    ax.set_xlabel('Region')
    ax.set_ylabel('Elevation')
    ax.set_title('What is the relationship between volcano elevation and region?')
    ax.axhline(data['Elevation'].median(), color='red', linestyle='--', label=f'Median Elevation: {data["Elevation"].median():.2f}')
    ax.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
